channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023100764
item.description:
Report E-2023100764

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1866 Ease Release 205 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100626
item.description:
Report E-2023100626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: DYERSBURG
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1199 was crushed during transit and released approximately forty-five (45) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. It was determined that all material released had fully evaporated prior to the crews arrival and was no longer recoverable. The damaged drum was located and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100754
item.description:
Report E-2023100754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 1 gallon of Acetone Solution (Hazardous - UN1090) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. The terminal advised they already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged jug, and oil-dri was placed into a 5 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023091097
item.description:
Report X-2023091097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: 1 quart bottle had a loose cap, resulting in leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: One out of three one-gallon bottles experienced leakage due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023081329
item.description:
Report X-2023081329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a damaged plastic jerrycan. The spill agent was told that the plastic jerrycan fell off the roller during the loading process. The fall caused a puncture on the bottom of the jerrycan. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement. X-2023081330-A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a damaged plastic jerrycan. The spill agent was told that the plastic jerrycan fell off the roller during the loading process. The fall caused a puncture on the bottom of the jerrycan. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
